transcript.text: Listen to the dialogue and practice your speaking, listening, and pronunciation skills.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: Hey Emily, how's it going?
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: Hey Alex, great to see you.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I'm doing well, thanks for asking.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: How about you?
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: Not bad, just a bit busy with work lately.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: But I'm always happy to catch up with you.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: Me too.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: So, what's new with you?
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: Well, I've been trying to get into gardening recently.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: Oh, that's cool. What have you been planting?
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I've started with some herbs like basil, rosemary, and thyme.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: And I'm also growing a few tomatoes and peppers.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: That sounds delicious.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I've always wanted to try gardening, but I'm not sure I have a green thumb.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: Don't worry, it's not that hard.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: And it's actually quite relaxing.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: Plus, it's a great way to get some fresh produce.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: Yeah, I might give it a try.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: What else have you been up to?
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I've also been taking some online courses in photography.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: I've always been interested in it, and I'm really enjoying learning about different techniques.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: That's great.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I've seen some of your photos on Instagram, and they're amazing.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: Thanks.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: I'm still practicing, but I'm getting better all the time.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: I'm sure you are.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: What kind of photography do you like most?
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I like to take pictures of nature in landscapes.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: But I'm also interested in portrait photography.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: I love nature photography too.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: There's something so calming about being in nature and capturing its beauty on camera.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I agree.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: And I find that portrait photography is a great way to capture people's personalities and emotions.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: That's true.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: So, what are your plans for the weekend?
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I'm planning to go hiking with some friends on Saturday.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: And then on Sunday, I'm going to visit my family.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: Sounds like a fun weekend.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: I'm going to a concert on Saturday night with my boyfriend.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: And then on Sunday, I'm just going to relax at home and catch up on some reading.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: Nice! I'm sure you'll have a great time.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: Thanks. I'll see you soon, Alex.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_02

transcript.text: See you later, Emily.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_01

transcript.text: To get into means to become involved or interested in something.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: It's like starting to participate in or enjoy a particular activity or hobby.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: For example, if you decide to get into hiking, it means you start to explore hiking trails and spend time outdoors enjoying nature.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: Capturing means recording or taking a picture of something, often to preserve a moment or image.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: It's like freezing a moment in time.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: For example, if you're capturing a sunset with your camera, you're taking a photograph to remember the beauty of the scene.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: A green thumb is an idiom used to describe someone who has a natural talent or ability for gardening and growing plants successfully.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: It's like being skilled at nurturing and caring for plants, so they thrive under your care.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

transcript.text: For example, if someone has a green thumb, they can make even the most difficult plants grow beautifully.
transcript.speaker: Speaker_00

How about you? Not bad, just a bit busy with work lately. But I'm always happy to catch up with you. Me too. So, what's new with you? Well, I've been trying to get into gardening recently. Oh, that's cool. What have you been planting? I've started with some herbs like basil, rosemary, and thyme. And I'm also growing a few tomatoes and peppers. That sounds delicious. I've always wanted to try gardening, but I'm not sure I have a green thumb. Don't worry, it's not that hard. And it's actually quite relaxing. Plus, it's a great way to get some fresh produce. Yeah, I might give it a try. What else have you been up to? I've also been taking some online courses in photography. I've always been interested in it, and I'm really enjoying learning about different techniques. That's great. I've seen some of your photos on Instagram, and they're amazing. Thanks. I'm still practicing, but I'm getting better all the time. I'm sure you are. What kind of photography do you like most? I like to take pictures of nature in landscapes. But I'm also interested in portrait photography. I love nature photography too. There's something so calming about being in nature and capturing its beauty on camera. I agree. And I find that portrait photography is a great way to capture people's personalities and emotions. That's true. So, what are your plans for the weekend? I'm planning to go hiking with some friends on Saturday. And then on Sunday, I'm going to visit my family. Sounds like a fun weekend. I'm going to a concert on Saturday night with my boyfriend. And then on Sunday, I'm just going to relax at home and catch up on some reading. Nice! I'm sure you'll have a great time. Thanks. I'll see you soon, Alex. See you later, Emily. To get into means to become involved or interested in something. It's like starting to participate in or enjoy a particular activity or hobby. For example, if you decide to get into hiking, it means you start to explore hiking trails and spend time outdoors enjoying nature. Capturing means recording or taking a picture of something, often to preserve a moment or image. It's like freezing a moment in time. For example, if you're capturing a sunset with your camera, you're taking a photograph to remember the beauty of the scene. A green thumb is an idiom used to describe someone who has a natural talent or ability for gardening and growing plants successfully. It's like being skilled at nurturing and caring for plants, so they thrive under your care. For example, if someone has a green thumb, they can make even the most difficult plants grow beautifully.
